ratings.comment: Fred was a terrible professor for this class. I found this class significantly harder than it should have been for an intro stats course. His lectures have no flow and sometimes you just have no idea what subject you're even on. He doesn't know how to explain concepts. When asked questions he told me to post it Learn@UW, which he rarely answered.

Fred seems to assume that students come into this intro stats class with previous stats knowledge because he does not fully explain any concepts. He is very unorganized which makes lectures very confusing. Fred requires the use of the program R too much and does not explain how to use it. I suggest taking this course with anyone other than Fred.

Fred's lectures are very confusing and unorganized. He is terrible at explaining concepts. He tries to be receptive to questions but often does not actually answer the questions in a helpful way. I feel that I learned next to nothing from this class. The one time that I went in to ask him questions and I found him very condescending.

Fred seems like a good guy. However, his lecture style is total unorganized, boring and nearly impossible to follow. His homework assignments are heavily based on a computer programing software, which does not appear at all on exams. I feel unprepared for exams. I would not take Fred again.

Fred is nice and definitely wants to help his students. That being said, he is NOT a good professor. He does not explain concepts well. He assumes students have more statistical background knowledge that they actually have. I have previous stats knowledge but I feel like I had a better understanding of stats before this class than after it.

If you haven't taken a stats course before don't take this class with Fred as your professor. He seems to assume that everyone has had previous experience in stats and doesn't fully explain concepts that are then on the exams. His lecturing style is very unorganized and the homework doesn't help prepare you for exams, which are graded harshly.

The homeworks don't really prepare you for the exams and are only worth 30% of your grade, the rest comes from tests. Not sure if this is TA specific but we lost all the points in a test question for simple math errors which really get you. Overall his teaching style was very all over the place and he goes on tangents a lot.

If you took AP stats, you will not have to put much effort into this class. I skipped discussions and lectures and just went over the posted course notes before the exams. Fred is always there to help. The material is just so easy if you have a background with statistics, it is definitely the easiest college class I have taken thus far. No textbook

Fred is a good guy but his way of teaching is ridiculous. His homework is completely different and most of it is done on a software but the tests are more theory based and thus are harder. Attend lectures and discussion classes and you should be fine.

Fred isn't the most interesting lecturer but he definitely is there to help anyone who asks for it. Sometimes the lectures can be confusing because he goes on tangents during his explanations. Overall, he wants every student to do well and is always welcoming to questions.
HWs and teaching style does not prepare you for tests.
Cool guy, boring class

Even though the course content is kind of boring, you can tell that Fred is really passionate about teaching statistics and loves what he does. He really wants his students to learn and loves when you come to office hours, ask questions, or participate in class. He tries to learn everyones name and make lecture atmosphere more like a discussion.
Easy

He is a great person and went out of his way to help everyone out during his office hours. He is disorganized but if you go to office hours he will not only help you understand but also go over most of the homework.

Fred has to be the nicest professor I have ever had. He made a real effort to learn our names and was extremely willing to help outside of class. He clearly cared a lot about our performance in his class. The class was a little unorganized and the use of several different textbooks didn't help.

Fred is a great guy who clearly is interested in how his students are doing, almost the point where he won't move on if someone doesn't get it (which can be a little frustrating at times). That being said, he is a great professor and I would definitely recommend him.

Fred has a fear of public speaking, so I do not know why he is a professor. I spent lectures sleeping/on my phone, and then used my 1 hour of discussion a week to learn stats from my TA. and get an A. Any other person could teach this class in 1 hour of lecture per week. His 50 minute lecture contains 5 minutes of material. easy but SO boring.

There's no doubt that Fred is a good guy who cares about his students and their success, but it's clear that he isn't comfortable in front of the class at times. He often rambles in lectures, making the main points difficult to discern. Also, the fact that he showed up 25 minutes late to an exam doesn't help.

Fred is a good guy, but seams unsure of himself.. He rambles during lecture and never jumps straight to the point. He uses multiple books and websites for the homework each week, and once showed up 25 minutes late for an exam.

Fred is a great professor who will always take the time to explain anything if you ask. Attend lecture and take notes and you will understand everything. If you are confused at all his office hours are extremely helpful. He definitely cares about his students understanding the material. One of the best professors I've had
